author: Iranzu García Vergara
title: La burbuja tras el apagón: así se han encarecido las radios y los hornillos
text:
PodcastHoy en El Debate
La burbuja tras el apagón: así se han encarecido las radios y los hornillos
Hoy El Debate hace una ruta por varias tiendas y establecimientos de electrónica en las que venden radios, hornillos, pilas o linternas para comprobar los precios y cómo ha subido la demanda de estos productos durante la última semana.
Aunque la mayor parte de los vendedores niegan haber aumentado los precios, algunos sí que admiten que lo han hecho. Si se compara en internet, los precios de las radios de hace unos meses con los actuales de algunas tiendas en el madrileño barrio de Chamberí, estos precios se han duplicado.
Una radio Aiwa RS-44 en la glorieta de Quevedo la venden a 44,90 euros. Al buscar su precio, online es bien diferente: 26,95 en Miravia o 29,29 en Amazon, y si se hace una comparativa de su precio con el mes de febrero en estas páginas web era entonces de 22,99 euros.
En el caso de una Sanyo KS102P su precio en este mismo establecimiento es de 32.90 euros, mientras que en Correos Market la venden a 16,49 euros. En el caso de los hornillos con una búsqueda rápida en internet se comprueba como también han subido de 22 euros en los meses de febrero y marzo, a 50 euros esta semana en Amazon.
Así es la imagen unos días después del apagón histórico sufrido en España, subida generalizada de precios de los productos de subsistencia y una amplia demanda tanto online como en las propias tiendas.

author: JubileeCast
title: Hillsong Church Loses Another US Campus
text:
Hillsong Church Loses Another US Campus
Hillsong Church announced that Hillsong San Francisco --- led by pastors Brenden and Jacqui Brown --- is separating from the Hillsong brand and will be independently run under a new name.
Previousy, Hillsong Church had 16 campuses in the US alone. However, with the scandals associated with Hillsong NYC Lead Pastor Carl Lentz in November 2020 over "leadership issues" and moral failures, including being unfaithful to his wife, Laura, the mega church now only has 5 American campuses left.
Hillsong Church Global Senior Pastor Phil Dooley has this to say, "After much prayer and thoughtful consideration, we're announcing that Brenden and Jacqui Brown will be taking on the leadership of our church community in San Francisco as a separate church, so separating from what has been part of Hillsong California."
"We believe the time is right for this. This is an exciting season for the Browns and for our church in San Francisco, and we want to say how much we love Brenden and Jacqui, and we value their dedication, their sacrifice, and their commitment to pastoring and leading the Hillsong San Francisco community," he added.
Hillsong San Francisco leaders, who have served the Evangelical megachurch network for 24 years, has this to say about leaving the Hillsong brand. "We're stepping into a new season as a new church! God has been faithful in every step of our journey, and we believe He's leading us into something fresh and full of purpose. While our name is changing, our heart remains the same-to love people and connect them to Jesus.
"We are so grateful for our @hillsong Church family, whose faith and investment have laid the foundation for this next season. A special thank you to our Global Senior Pastors @philldooley_ and @lucindadooley , California Lead Pastors @samlopez and @courtneylopez , and the Global Board for their leadership, love, and support."
The church will be announcing their new name next week. "Join us next Sunday as we reveal the new name of our church and unpack the vision for what's ahead! We can't wait to step into this new season together. "

author: fijivillage
title: Heavy Rain Warning and Flash Flood Alert whole of Fiji
text: A Heavy Rain Warning is now in force for the whole of Fiji Group while a Flash Flood Alert remains in force for all low lying, flash flood prone areas and small streams of Fiji. The Nadi Weather Office says an active trough of low pressure, with associated cloud and rain, continues to affect the entire Fiji Group. They say heavy rainfall may result in flash flooding in low-lying, flood-prone areas and small streams. The National Disaster Risk Management Office is urging the public to remain vigilant for possible flash flooding in low-lying areas, informal settlements, small streams, and Irish crossings, which could disrupt traffic flow. They advise drivers to exercise extra caution when driving, as roads have deteriorated due to the continuous rainfall experienced over the past few days.

author: MENAFN
title: Israel Sees COP29 As Opportunity To Expand Climate Cooperation With Azerbaijan
text: Forgot Username or Password Date (MENAFN- AzerNews) Ulviyya Shahin Read more The 29th session of the conference of the Parties to the UN Framework convention on Climate Change (COP29) presents an excellent opportunity to enhance cooperation between Azerbaijan and Israel on climate issues. Azernews reports that Yoav Bistritsky, Deputy Ambassador of Israel to Azerbaijan, stated this on his account on the 'X' social network. 'COP29 is an excellent opportunity to expand cooperation between Israel and Azerbaijan on climate change issues. We participated in an online meeting of experts from both countries, where we discussed similar desertification problems and possible solutions,' he said. The diplomat emphasized that the Israeli side plans to organize parallel events during the climate conference scheduled to take place in Baku. author: JACKSON WALKER | The National Desk
title: chevron-right
text: {p}Former ESPN anchor Sage Steele claims she was asked by the network to refrain from commenting on controversial transgender swimmer Lia Thomas.{br}{/p}{p}Lia Thomas, a transgender female, {a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/former-upenn-swimmer-slams-school-for-handling-of-lia-thomas-controversy-gaslighting-and-fearmongering-university-of-pennsylvania-transgender-swimming-womens-team-sports-athletics-ncaa\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/former-upenn-swimmer-slams-school-for-handling-of-lia-thomas-controversy-gaslighting-and-fearmongering-university-of-pennsylvania-transgender-swimming-womens-team-sports-athletics-ncaa\"}joined {/a}the University of Pennsylvania's women’s swimming team in 2021 after originally being on the men's team. She went on to become an NCAA champion.{/p}{p}Thomas's participation in women's events was followed by the creation of “Fairness in Women’s Sports Acts,” legislation that aims to require athletes to compete based on biological sex.{/p}{p}While anchoring \"SportsCenter\" for ESPN, Steele frequently expressed opposition to Thomas and other transgender females competing in women's sports on social media. In an {a href=\"https://twitter.com/Outkick/status/1739993995311272221\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://twitter.com/Outkick/status/1739993995311272221\"}interview {/a}with women's sports activist Riley Gaines this week, she claimed her comments led to internal backlash at work.{/p}{p}“I was asked to stop tweeting about it,” Steele said. “I was asked to stop doing anything, saying anything about it on social media because I was offending others at the company. I made sure I sent up another tweet that night after I received that email because like, no.”{/p}{p}{strong}READ MORE |{a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/no-one-protected-us-riley-gaines-slams-transgender-participation-in-womens-sports-during-house-hearing#\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/no-one-protected-us-riley-gaines-slams-transgender-participation-in-womens-sports-during-house-hearing#\"} 'No one protected us': Riley Gaines slams trans females competing in women's sports during House hearing{/a}{/strong}{/p}{p}{sd-embed class=\"sd-embedded-media\" data-embed-file=\"1740108515254153223\" data-embed-type=\"twitter\" contenteditable=\"false\"}{/sd-embed}{/p}{p}Steele and ESPN parted ways in 2023 after she launched a lawsuit claiming the company infringed her free speech rights, {a href=\"https://nypost.com/2023/12/27/sports/sage-steele-espn-said-stop-tweeting-about-trans-swimmer-lia-thomas/\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://nypost.com/2023/12/27/sports/sage-steele-espn-said-stop-tweeting-about-trans-swimmer-lia-thomas/\"}according{/a} to The New York Post. Speaking to Gaines, Steele explained the messages were part of the reason why she felt so strongly about the suit.{br}{/p}{p}“I already had the lawsuit going. I didn’t know what how it was going to end. But I literally said, this is the hill I will die on 100% because it’s facts,” she said. “This is not even my opinion about a vaccine mandate or whatever, these are facts. This is science, this is biology.\"{/p}{blockquote}\"Tell me to stop supporting women,\" Steele continued. \"Go ahead, tell me.”{/blockquote}{p}Gaines, who competed against Thomas in 2022, applauded Steele, saying she \"could not imagine being a woman working there, being asked to report on this issue with a smile on my face.\"{/p}{p}{strong}READ MORE |{ }{a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/republican-governors-demand-ncaa-rewrite-transgender-student-athlete-policy-gop-kristi-noem-greg-abbott-riley-gaines-fairness-womens-sports-trans-rules-lia-thomas#\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/republican-governors-demand-ncaa-rewrite-transgender-student-athlete-policy-gop-kristi-noem-greg-abbott-riley-gaines-fairness-womens-sports-trans-rules-lia-thomas#\"}Republican governors demand NCAA rewrite transgender student athlete policy{/a}{/strong}{/p}{p}Former University of Pennsylvania swimmer Paula Scanlan {a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/former-upenn-swimmer-slams-school-for-handling-of-lia-thomas-controversy-gaslighting-and-fearmongering-university-of-pennsylvania-transgender-swimming-womens-team-sports-athletics-ncaa\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/news/americas-news-now/former-upenn-swimmer-slams-school-for-handling-of-lia-thomas-controversy-gaslighting-and-fearmongering-university-of-pennsylvania-transgender-swimming-womens-team-sports-athletics-ncaa\"}said {/a}during a House hearing earlier this year her university forced biologically female athletes to fear for their safety by allowing Thomas into women’s locker rooms.{/p}{p}“The university was gaslighting and fearmongering women to validate the feelings and identity of a male,” Scanlan said. She claimed the University of Pennsylvania urged her to seek counseling after she presented them with concerns over sharing a locker room with Thomas.{/p}{p}ESPN declined to comment on Steele's allegations Thursday.
